duties_responsibilities.duty: Delegate rework of unsatisfactory O&M work practices and implement policy/procedural updates to improve the quality of the O&M program.
Conduct all required QC inspections, including mandated percentages of QC evaluations, and generate reports for management and government counterparts.
Oversee daily operations to ensure program compliance with applicable codes, standards, laws, etc., as per the contractual statement of work.
Provide health, safety, and environmental-related training to contract employees to ensure compliance with all applicable requirements.
Facilitate all task order fleet management requirements and contractual reporting.
Act as a liaison between subcontractors, government representatives, and various medical research organizations.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in a directly related field of study (Master's preferred)
USACE Quality Management for Contractors Certification
CPR/AED and Standard First Aid Trainer's Certification
